intro: Brignolia pastinacifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It features lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive blue-green color. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
